intro: Hieracium amphitiltum, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium amphitiltum is often found in open, rocky areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
